attributes.action: Insist the Scottish Government abide by our basic human rights
attributes.additional_details: We have heard the Scottish Government continually apply restrictions based on their judgement and not scientific facts.  As the Human Rights Chief Executive said back in September, “If we want to protect public health and save lives, then changes need to complement or enhance our human rights, not treat them as optional.”
attributes.background:
Insist the Scottish Government abide by our basic human rights such as family life, freedom of assembly and the right to earn a living.  
The Scottish Government are currently applying Covid-19 restrictions that are disproportionate and not grounded in science or law.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: 

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
